title: Spring 6 / Spring Boot 3 compatibility layer

labels.name: area/spring
labels.description: Issues relating to the Spring integration

body:
### Description

Our current Spring compatibility layer targets Spring 5 / Spring Boot 2.

I assume that Spring 6 / Spring Boot 3 have slightly different APIs/dependencies, be it only when it comes to Jakarta EE, which could make the Spring 5 / Spring Boot 2 compatibility layer unusable for people migrating from Spring 6 / Spring Boot 3 to Quarkus (though I'd be happy to be proven wrong).

If that's the case, should we duplicate the current Spring 5 / Spring Boot 2 compatibility layer and create a separate Spring 6 / Spring Boot 3 compatibility layer?

### Implementation ideas

We're not there yet, I just wanted to discuss whether this is necessary or not.
